Class FloridianToothRecords

java.lang.Object
FloridianToothRecords
public class FloridianToothRecords extends Object
Class FloridianToothRecords Controls all family dental record operations.

    static void
    computeRootCanalIndices(char[][][] teeth, int[][] toothCounts, int numPeople)
    Compute the family's root canal indices: roots of I*x^2 + B*x - M = 0, where I, B, M are totals across all people and layers.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Main method controls program flow.
      Parameters:
      args - command-line arguments (not used)

    • getNumberOfPeople

      public static int getNumberOfPeople(Scanner sc)
      Prompt for and return a valid number of people (1..MAX_PEOPLE). Error re-prompts appear on the same line to match sample behavior.
      Parameters:
      sc - Scanner for input
      Returns:
      number of people

    • inputFamilyData

      public static void inputFamilyData(Scanner sc, String[] names, char[][][] teeth, int[][] toothCounts, int numPeople)
      Input names and teeth strings for each family member. Validates teeth strings and stores uppercase characters in teeth array. Error re-prompts (invalid types / too many teeth) re-ask on the same line.
      Parameters:
      sc - Scanner for input
      names - array to store names
      teeth - 3D char array to store tooth letters
      toothCounts - counts per person per layer
      numPeople - number of people in family

    • isValidTeethString

      public static boolean isValidTeethString(String s)
      Validate a teeth string: must contain only letters I, B, or M (any case).
      Parameters:
      s - input string
      Returns:
      true if valid, false otherwise

    • menuLoop

      public static void menuLoop(Scanner sc, String[] names, char[][][] teeth, int[][] toothCounts, int numPeople)
      Main menu loop. Accepts P/E/R/X options (case-insensitive) and dispatches. Error re-prompts for invalid menu option appear on same line.
      Parameters:
      sc - Scanner for input
      names - array of names
      teeth - 3D teeth array
      toothCounts - counts per person per layer
      numPeople - number of people

    • printFamilyRecords

      public static void printFamilyRecords(String[] names, char[][][] teeth, int[][] toothCounts, int numPeople)
      Print the family's teeth records in a readable format.
      Parameters:
      names - array of names
      teeth - 3D teeth array
      toothCounts - counts per person per layer
      numPeople - number of people

    • extractTooth

      public static void extractTooth(Scanner sc, String[] names, char[][][] teeth, int[][] toothCounts, int numPeople)
      Extract (remove) a tooth: asks for family member, layer (U/L), tooth number. Validates entries and ensures the tooth is not already missing before setting it to 'M'. Error re-prompts are printed on the same line (invalid family member, invalid layer, invalid tooth number, missing tooth).
      Parameters:
      sc - Scanner for input
      names - array of names
      teeth - 3D teeth array
      toothCounts - counts per person per layer
      numPeople - number of people

    • findPersonIndex

      public static int findPersonIndex(String[] names, String query, int numPeople)
      Find the index of a person by name (case-insensitive).
      Parameters:
      names - array of names
      query - queried name
      numPeople - number of people
      Returns:
      index or -1 if not found

    • computeRootCanalIndices

      public static void computeRootCanalIndices(char[][][] teeth, int[][] toothCounts, int numPeople)
      Compute the family's root canal indices: roots of I*x^2 + B*x - M = 0, where I, B, M are totals across all people and layers.
      Parameters:
      teeth - 3D teeth array
      toothCounts - counts per person per layer
      numPeople - number of people
